Skin testing must be completed before treatment; use intradermal inj of 0.1 ml of a 1:1000 dilution (5 mcg horse IgG) in 0.9% NaCl; if wheal or rash >10 mm or both, use caution during infusion
Dilute in saline sol before infusion; invert IV bag so undiluted product does not contact air inside; concentration should not be >4 mg/ml; do not shake

sec_title.route: Keep emergency equipment nearby for severe allergic reaction

section.para: Fever, chills, headache, dizziness, weakness, faintness, seizures
Chest pain, hypo/hypertension, tachycardia
Diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, epigastric pain, GI bleeding
Rash, pruritus, urticaria, wheal, injection-site reactions

para.emphasis: Anaphylaxis

section.para: Fever, chills, headache, seizures, light-headedness, encephalitis, postviral encephalopathy
Bradycardia, myocarditis, irregularity
Nausea, LFTs abnormality

para.emphasis: Thrombocytopenia, leukopenia
Backache
Dyspnea, pulmonary edema

section.para: Onset rapid, half-life 5-7 days

item.para: Infection: if infection occurs, evaluation will be needed to continue therapy
Renal studies: BUN, creatinine at least monthly during treatment, for 3 mo after treatment
Hepatic studies: alk phos, AST, ALT, bilirubin
CBC with differential
Therapeutic response: absence of rejection; hematologic recovery (aplastic anemia)
To report fever, chills, sore throat, fatigue, since serious infections may occur

sec_title.route: To use contraceptive measures during treatment, for 12 wk after therapy
